Even if you order to go, you'd end up waiting at least 20 minutes or so. The evenings are little less packed, because I presume all the FiDi bankers have gone home by then.
author: Srivatsan S.

description: This is by far my family's FAVORITE traditional ramen spot. Small, charming, and always delicious. I get the spicy miso ramen add extra ramen, extra egg, pork belly, and chicken dumpling. If you like spicy, ask for a side of habanero sauce (a little goes a long way).
author: Antonio B.

description: Not gonna lie, this place is super mediocre. I don't really understand the hype. Not enough effort and thought is put in to any of their ramen. Spicy miso, tonkotsu, all pretty typical Americanized noodle shop. All the vegetables are raw, not even a quick, light blanch. The toppings and extras are way overpriced, and theres too many unnecessary options. They should just stick to a few and make it well. Make a better half-boiled egg. HAVE a half-boiled egg. No one wants to eat a hard boiled egg with their ramen.
author: Cody M.

description: Excellent place for ramen if you are in San Francisco. And the habanero broth is good, if you can take the heat.
author: Co C.

description: I ordered for takeout. The soup is salty. Added extra chicken for $2 but it is not worth it. They just gave me a couple chopped chicken slices.
author: Arthur J.

description: It used to be good in the past few year. I used to like it a lot but I don't know why the taste is jusy soso. Notthing impressed me like the  past.
author: Orange S.

description: Why are people willing to stand and wait? Move on people, there's better and higher quality ramen places in the bay. Had the Tonkontsu broth with ramen. Base was bland. The basics came with ramen, button mushrooom and spinach. I noticed there wasn't an egg or chashu, and it was too late to add any. It's a simple ramen soup with simple ingredients. The flavors were bland.
author: mary v.

description: Worst ramen! We were a big group and got all the different kinds of broth and toppings on the menu. Personally I got the shoyu pork and it literally taser like instant ramen. Ew. Just salty bland soup and bland noodles. I was pretty sad after that.
author: Angela A.

description: First time at this location - I ordered the spicy miso with kimchi, egg and extra noodles.  It was not as spicy as i was hoping for but it was a very good portion (i try to eat a huge lunch so this is a must), flavorful, and reasonably priced.  With all my options $15.  The only downfall was the  portion of kimchi and i would have rather had pork than chicken.  Not the end of the world in my book.  Definite repeat customer here.
author: Stuart B.

description: I've had a lot of ramen in my life and this place unfortunately left a lot to be desired. The portions are nicely sized, but the noodles aren't the chewy, curly delicious homemade noodles one comes to expect when eating authentic ramen. The chicken was poached on the side and sitting out on the counter and they cut it and place it in the soup per order - basically, it's completely dried out at that point rendering it flavorless. I will say the staff was fast, friendly and attentive. But probably not coming back any time soon.
author: Alex L.

description:
Tried Ramen Underground for lunch today. Was happy with the large bowl with good amount of veggies and tasty broth. The chicken was a surprise (instead of pork) but i guess healthy is good. It's cash only and the smaller the number of people in your group, perhaps the better since it can get pretty crowded.
My exercise was primarily to compare spicy miso ramen between Sushi Bay (which is across the street) and Ramen Underground and I think the Sushi Bay has a slight edge, but that's probably a personal preference. They're both pretty good.
author: Malvika J.

description: The food was decent. However, the lady who served us had a really bad attitude. One of us did not feel like eating anything. Therefore she just wanted to sit and chat. When the lady realized that my friend was not going to order food, she told her that there was a minimum charge for every customer and you have to leave if you do not plan to order anything. So my friend decided to leave. The drama did not end. After we were done, we paid the check. We paid 15% tips for the meal, which we thought it was a standard. However, the lady came and told us that the tips we paid was too less. We have to follow their guideline to pay the tips (the minimum is 18%). Since we were in a hurry, we just paid whatever she asked us to pay. To be honest, the ramen there was good. But the lady's attitude leaves us a really bad impression. We may not come to visit this place again.
author: Ernie Y.

description:
Some may find this statement deeply offensive, but this is my favorite ramen spot, not just in SF, but in America. But also, I haven't traveled much so that probably says a lot in itself.

I've tried Ken Ken Ramen, Izakaya Sozai, Genki Ramen, Waraku, Men Oh, Ajisen, Katana-ya, Orenchi in Santa Clara, Dohatsuten in Mountain View, Totto Ramen in NY,  one other ramen place in San Mateo that wasn't Ramen Dojo and a lot of others that were completely forgettable. Out of all of those places, none of them beat Ramen Underground's Shoyu Ramen with kakuni, soft boiled egg, and tofu. Once in a while, this place isn't perfect - the pork might be dry, the soft boiled egg a little overcooked, but the noodles and broth are always consistently flavorful and to me, that's the most important part. I love the variety of toppings they have, but I agree that it can really add up. I also love that they offer to-go options for when my boyfriend is sick or if I'm ordering during work. I used to hate ramen, but after my first time trying it here, I went on a quest to find more ramen places that could possibly be better - little did I know after being disappointed at all of those other places, my favorite ramen has been here all along.
author: Sandy T.

description: Really good!!!  We used to go to the place across the street, but once we found this place we where hooked.  I think that it has to do with, the amount of choices and items you can add.  Highly recomend both, but if you want a better sitdown place give them a try.
author: Frank C.

description: The ramen was amazing!! I highly recommend coming back for the ramen, however we had some experiences there that made us not want to come back. We had a party of 7 (apparently we blocked the whole restaurant way due to a really small restaurant), and of course we got charged for it for "blocking the way". That isn't the reason why we were kinda disappointed. We weren't happy because they charged us $2.50 each outside drink we brought in. There were no signs of saying "No Outside Drinks", even if there were signs about it, the waiter or any employees didn't tell us that they will be charging us for each outside drink! They could've mentioned it, but didn't. Thats pretty much the reason why I give this place a 2 star. The ramen is good, but yeah this place needs to step up there game.
author: Calista H.

description: I love this place. When I'm craving ramen this place is always in the mix. I typically get the spicy miso with extra noodles, pork belly and sometimes tofu. The broth is spicy and very warm. The spice is great here because it isn't overpowering. A lot of times when I get spicy miso at other restaurants, it's so spicy I can't really taste anything else. Also, when you order extra noodles, you definitely get a large extra helping of noodles. What really keeps bringing me back here is their consistency. They always are able to provide quality ramen every time. If you are craving ramen and don't know want to risk a bad meal, this is your place!
author: Alex L.

description:
Ramen Underground was our favorite in the city. 

Last night we went there after it moved (and under new management?) across the street. 

Disappointment will be an understatement. More like I think the new place is ruining the restaurant name and the concept of good ramen.

We ordered the usual: spicy miso ramen and soy milk ramen.

The noddles come with chicken (on this later), spinach, mushroom. Egg still costs extra. The bowls are much bigger than before.

If you think you are getting a better deal. You are very very very wrong. 

Chicken. No Chashu pork. A big chunk of white chicken breast meat, dry, flavorless, mushy. This thing is completely out of place here.

Soup base. No the thick rich soup you used to get. The base is thin, flavorless. I could hardly taste any miso. The "soy milk" base is just milky white water.

The noddle is still decent. 

Ramen to me is the ultimate comfort food. This new place is selling anything but.

Please, if you have fond memories of that old cramped place at 355 Kearny and love Ramen Underground, do NOT waste your time and go to the new place. 

It is NOT The Ramen Underground you know, heard or remembered.
author: Kevin L.

description: I liked this hole in the wall. I ordered the spicy ramen with the pork belly and it was soooo spicy, a bit unexpected. Most places say is spicy and then is not. This one is.... yummy. broth is delicious and the pork belly was a nice extra on top. This place is no fuzz. you walk in, you seat down, eat and leave. Easy and fast service. Will be back.
author: Susana G.

description: I ordered their Miso Ramen and it was actually pretty good. The ramen and the Miso soup itself is very smooth and delicious. The reason why I gave a 2 star review is because of the problem we had in the restaurant. They charged us a $5 fee for bringing in 2 outside drinks ($2.50 per drink brought). However, there were no signs that said "Outside Food Or Drinks Will Be Charged". It was extremely unfair, and a total shock when we received the check. Also, they had charged us an extra $10 for having a "big group" of 7 people. Apparently we were crowding the restaurant, thus rejecting customers from receiving their seats. The employees did not warn us and so, we had to pay the extra fee. My group was very unhappy with their service, but satisfied with their food.
author: Ivana T.

description: This place is always packed when I walk by. Finally, I went in one night when it wasn't crowded. The vegetarian ramen was very disappointing, and it didn't have an egg. The noodles were too stiff like they were over cooked or left out. The services wasn't attentive; the waiters were chatting with each other and didn't see we finished a long time ago. It's a small space so it shouldn't be that hard to get waiters' attention.
author: A J.

description: It wasnt bad but it wasn't great either. It was kind of bland and I wish they had some kind of sauces or even a lemon to put on top to kind of bring the flavor out. The tiramisu matcha cake was not all that great either. It was also kind of bland. I like that they mentioned on their menu that they don't use msg and that the waiter was fast and had good customer service! The food could have been better and there wasbt really a wide variety.
author: Jolynne T.

description: The ramen here was delicious. I had the tonkatsu ramen and my friend had spicy miso. I added pork belly and garlic butter and it was awesome. It was definitely worth the wait. I also like that it is across the street from Plentea.
author: Lee A.

description: This spot is one of my favorite ramen spots. I usually get spicy miso ramen with kimchi and egg. I work and live ode to this place, and I've had both weekday lunch and weekend dinner/lunch there. Based on what I've noticed it feels like the weekday lunch chef is better than the dinner/weekend one. I'm n to sure If there are actually different chefs there, but the soup tastes different depending on the day/time you go. Long lines for lunch and cash only :(
author: Aya J.

description: I don't really eat ramen all the time but I really enjoyed the bowl I had. The broth was rich and tasty and the noodles were just right. It's a small place and you have to write your name on a board outside. There was a line waiting to get in when I first walked by. Of course that peaked my curiosity. I'm glad I tried it and can't wait to come back.
author: A T.

description:
made it back to try another type of ramen

ordered:
-tonkatsu + kotteri + kakuni + boiled egg: it was good but i kept going back to my memory of what the soy milk ramen here tasted like and wished i had ordered it instead! 

they ran out of green tea tiramisu so i have yet to try it =( 

next time im back, im def ordering the soy milk.. just hope it's as good as i remember!

notes:
-long lines, cash only
author: Raquel T.

description:
Ugh this is a tough one. The staff is generally friendly and I really love the soup here - it's made with organic chicken broth which is great, because it tastes really good and doesn't hurt my stomach like other pork-based ramen usually does. BUT I have to give 2 stars because the prices here are just outrageous! They've hiked up their prices I think since moving across the road and now a base soup with basically no toppings runs $11-$12 + tax, and by the time you add simple things like egg and dumplings that usually come standard with ramen, your bill is closer to $20! For a bowl of noodle soup! I wish they would re work their pricing structure but this place is still plenty busy so may just end up being a sign of the changing SF restaurant clientele...

Ps. I also just noticed the change from pork to dry chicken as the standard meat in the soup. Not thrilled.
author: Sasha N.

description:
Walked up and saw a crowd waiting outside, I took this as a good sign. You are going to wait but its not too bad. Line moves pretty quickly.

Unless you haven't eaten in two days don't get the extra noodles. The order comes with plenty. The spicy miso was really good. I added pork belly and dumplings, both delish!
author: Valerie V.

description: If you like ramen this is how it's supposed to be.  Very fresh and lots of choices but the basic is great chicken, spinach, mushrooms, green onion. Around $10 a bowl, you can add extra noodles for a buck.  Everyone in the family liked it.  The place is small seats and 35.  If you go to china town this is a great spot to eat. Cash only!!
author: Todd M.

description: I got the tonkotsu broth ramen. It was good but for the price, I'd rather go somewhere else. The base price is about $11 and the bowls don't come with much as far as toppings go. Additional toppings cost from $1-$4 so it really adds up. Despite that, I did add pork belly and egg (wish they had bamboo shoots though). The pork belly definitely tasted better than the chashu but my egg came pretty broken. The broth was nice and milky but I truly wonder if their "No MSG" claim is legit. The service was SPECTACULAR. I'd probably go back if I was really craving ramen.
author: Maggi K.

description: I came here once a week in the past month! My go-to: tonkotsu, of course! There's always a line, so you'll need to get here early, especially during lunch time. They do take out too! I noticed that if you ask them to separate the noodles from the broth, they give you a little less broth. So it might be better to just leave it all in one container. Dinner doesn't get as crowded as lunch does.
author: Lina C.

description: The atmosphere and wait is annoying, but don't let that dissuade you from having the amazing ramen.
author: Craig K.

description: Had a friend tell me about this place and tried it. Ordered the spicy miso with egg and dumplings and it was delicious. It was bursting with flavor it had a delicious spice and good customer service. Will definitely come here Again.
author: Bryan P.

description: Try the broth with soymilk with additional corn, spinach, boiled egg and  braised pork belly.  The portion is  very filling.  The line by the door tells you it is  not  just  good ramen- it is veryyyyy good!!!!!
author: Yna D.

description: Ramen was good but service was extremely slow. They need to hire more waiters. Not worth going back.
author: Leo Z.

description: Good food, wonderful staff! Came just before closing, but that wasn't a problem at all. A place to go if you tired and hungry
author: A L.

description: I dont think its really that much worse than before.  wonder why the rating is so low...3.5 stars I will give.  service can be better.  be smiley!
author: Shuting Z.

description: I got the miso ramen. Very flavorful broth but I think noodles could be better! Decent ramen!
author: Malina M.

description: Ehhh this place is so overrated. The employees here does not care for their tables and pays no attention whatsoever. Because we had a party of 6 the server probably didn't care cause they were getting gratuity either way. The ramen was plain and adding additional toppings could make your ramen total up to $20+ after tip and tax. There's nothing special about this place. Go elsewhere.
author: Samson L.

description: finally made it here for the first time. tried the tonkatsu ramen, overall not bad. the noodles had a good consistency as did the broth. broth had a good amount of taste to it. it was good to come here on a weekday around 1pm as there wasnt a need to wait for a table.
author: Alex H.

description:
Not really sure what the big deal is with this place.  The Tonkatsu broth might as well be veggie broth, the noodles are undercooked (I believe this may be authentic, but is not my preference), and the server was rude.

The food was okay, but I vastly preferred this other place on Post St which I unfortunately don't know the name of.
author: Reese H.

description: Ramen here was excellent. And you can really customize your order. Looks like they have togo as well (in large plastic soup containers). Look forward to returning.
author: Will D.

description: My favorite place to go after work in the city! Fresh ingredients, lively atmosphere, great service. Im a veghead and my favorite thing is the veggie ramen with spicy miso. Yuuummmm!!!
author: Soleia L.

description: Totally acceptable ramen, but not the best. This is in part due to the fact that the broth is chicken, not pork. The soft boiled egg and the pork belly however were excellent. My colleagues and I went because we heard they accepted Bitcoin, but alas they do not. :-(
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: Solid ramen place; big bowls, variety, and what you would expect for ramen taste. Perhaps a bit expensive than one would expect for ramen, but doesn't seem to stop the lines of people out the door waiting for a seat.
author: Sarah T.

description: Food is amazing got the noodle bowl and the price isn't bad at all. Only why I left off a star bc it's cash only. Def a place to check out.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Ok so I liked it the first time I tried this place when it was in its original spot. Small Cozy and not so uppity. 
Since they moved across the street my second visit. The soup was a bit too salty but still had the same flavor. I guess you can't have perfection all the time. 
What I do want to point out is the color coding of pens when you order. Yes. The waitress corrected me as I sat down that the PINK marker is for Togo orders. I need to use the black marker (one was available on the table) to order for here. Really? She made me redo my scan tron and then took my order.
author: chi l.

description:
I've only just been introduced to this place last year, which is really sad. I can't really call myself a good native if I live and work in the district. The wait is about 10-25 minutes, the latter if it's really busy that night amd people jus aren't leavimg. The disappointing thing now is that they've chamged their ramen recipe a bit. Instead of a slice of chashu, you get chicken that's been reduced to a meek pile becauae they simmered it for too long to make their base. Chashu is now a $2 topping. Japan is crying from overseas. 

I always get the spicy miso. The heat changes from time to time, but it was perfect last night. Had me reaching for the water a couple times and my nose started to run, but I wasn't tearing up or sweating. The basic toppings are good, but you have to get the egg, even though it's $1 extra. Were these chicken fed grapes by virgins with feather fans or something? Stradivarius violin playing as they boiled the eggs? They also changed the noodles. It felt more like boxed thin spaghetti than actual ramen. I'm left wondering if they ran out of ramen noodles or if management decided it was time to switch from caring about their food to caring about their money. I'm sure they're crying all the way to the bank at this one customer's letdown.

The guy running the table seems like a great guy, very attentive to your needs. The girl working the cashier has told me consistently, every time I've eaten here, that my change wasn't enough for tips. I can sympathize that minimum wage must suck and living in SF is expensive, but why don't you worry about providing good service first, because that's what determines your tip. One time she even screwed up amd forgot a whole side of the bar's order and failed to apologize as others arrived, ate, and left, before we even got a notice. I'm pretty generous with tips but I'm pretty sure you don't deserve more than a couple dollars for that, if any. I always give more though because that one poor guy has to take care of the entire floor, which is no easy endeavor.

Still, ~15 bucks for a meal is enough to smile at. My friend always gets a billion toppings and so both her bowl and bill is bigger, so you actually can end up spending a lot for what other places would've given you as their basic bowl. But you end up bringing home leftovers so that's something. Oh, and to end on a winning note? You can get ice cream next door now.
author: Rachel H.

description: We waited too long. Our waiter confronted us in not leaving him a hefty enough tip, completely ruined the mood of our party. Disappointed with the crude and rushed service.
author: Ernesto M.

description: The waiter is nice and that's about the only positive thing. The soup was a huge disappointment, not very flavorful and was rather bland. Adding salt won't help, it's lacking the umame taste. And the meat is also a bit bland. I've definitely had better ramen elsewhere.
author: Julia P.

description: Wretched service for mediocre ramen. Made me wait 30 minutes for my food. When I confronted them about the time issue, they blamed me for it. When finally given my food, was offered no compensation. I asked if I could have something as small as a bottle of water for my trouble, and the waiters ignored me the rest of the time I was there. Avoid.
author: Brandon G.

description: I honestly don't understand why there always seems to be a huge line for this place...perhaps because it takes so long to get your food?! I've only been in for takeout here a couple of times during odd hours, so it wasn't that crowded, however both times after placing my order, I stood around waiting for 20 minutes and both times the order has been totally wrong - wrong kind of broth and missing extras that I had paid for and/or including extras I did not want. My ticket numbers were written on the container, so I'm not sure if the cook messed up or if the wait staff did. Either way, I don't think ramen should be this complicated and I probably won't be returning.
author: Sarah G.

description: Food quality and service has gone down significantly after they moved locations to across the street. There are simply too many better places to get ramen than this place now.
author: Marc S.

description: Good ramen is hard to come by and this place definitely delivers. Most places don't know how to properly spice their food, but they didn't hold back here. I'm not sure I could handle their spiciest dishes, but there's nothing wrong with a little burn.
author: Travis P.

description: The line was out the door on a Friday afternoon and we ended up waiting for about 30 minutes. Ordered the spicy miso broth with pork belly and a boiled egg. The broth was delicious and very comforting since the weather was so cold, but I was expecting it to have more of a spicy kick. I was really let down with the pork belly.. It was hard, not tender like it usually is served at other ramen places. The meat was hard to chew and the flavor was a little off-putting.. Even though the pork was a disappointment, I still thoroughly enjoyed my bowl of ramen. I'll probably come back here if the wait isn't too long!
author: Krizia M.

description: Decent Ramen if you are looking for something reasonably priced. They have some good options for add-ones and a very simple menu which is a huge plus.  There is almost always a line, but you can always add your name and grab a Plentea boba across the street for while you wait (although that IS a lot of liquid!)
author: Shay S.

description: Went here last night after drinks at Rickhouse.. Perfectly cooked soft boiled egg, crispy pork belly. Totally worth the price unlike other reviews say as the ingredients are stellar.. I loved the spicy miso and the pork broth. Wish they took credit cards and had different noodle choices like rice or something more authentic than what appears to be pasta noodles.
author: sarah p.

description: They just move from a tiny space across the street on Kearny. Saturday schedule suppose  to open at 11:30 am we arrive  4 minutes before 11:30 . Today is a windy day and ask if we can take a seat. The cashier/ waiter snap at us. We interrupted his phone conversation, he  was very nasty mentioning that they have a lot of thing to do before they see patrons.  He gave as a lecture .we mention it is already 11:30 am  and we just wanted to wait and get away from the wind. We were going to be happy to wait inside and have a seat at a table until they were ready to see us.  We decided to leave since he had  so nasty disposition.  It does not hurt to invite us to seat and we will have being happy that way to wait for them  to finish with their preparation
author: Lydia H.

description: (Spicy miso):  Must order! All 5 stars are for this dish.  Plenty spicy, rich miso, and the mushrooms has made this my favorite bowl yet.  Definitely come here. Its my favorite of the bay!
author: Garrett M.

description:
Three stars because the only good thing was the ramen noodles.  
My friends and I came here on a Wednesday around 4ish. There was no line or wait because it was before dinner time. We were not greeted or even seated. We stood there a bit awkwardly and realized that we were probably going to have to seat ourselves.  Took them 5 minutes to get us our menus but they took our order right away.... so I guess it kind of makes up for the lack or attentiveness.  
My friends ordered the tonkatsu and spicy soy sauce while I got the spicy miso.  It was alright,  like I said the noodles were the only good part.  I was really disappointed,  the only gave me mushrooms and 1 sliver, not slice, sliver of meat. What is up with that? Did they like run out? The other portions seemed to have a wide array of condiments.  I was surprised by the spinach in ramen. 
Service was bad, they didn't greet us, no one checked up to see if we needed anything else.  We had to ask for our own water. The lady next to our table came in before us and didn't get a menu until we got our bowls of ramen and the man on the other side of us didn't have water and napkins.....
It was a pretty disappointing experience.
author: Julie C.

description: Place is always crowded. Ramen can get expensive. Long wait and combination of just ok ramen brings this place down. May try again....maybe.
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Idunno what the hype is about. The line is always long, I tried to wait for a spot for one and watched open single seats remain open while the overwhelmed wait staff overlooked them. I finally ordered to-go and regretted it because that took super long too. I ordered miso broth with added wontons and mushrooms and my total was like $14, dumb. The miso was way murkier than I am used to, I guess I'm not a connoisseur but it tasted like they added some sort of dairy to it, no dice. Also the noodles were definitly not $14 ramen status, I got a bowl of ramen for $6 at Lee's that had way better noodles. But the real deal breaker was how incredibly salty the broth was. By the time I actually got to eat the elusive soup I felt like I needed to get back to work so since it was so hot and soooo salty I added like 3 ice cubes to it to cool it to quick-eating temp and to dilute the salt. It barely made a dent in that saline soup!! I ate less than half and tossed her out, bye bye $9 and 30+ mins of my time :'(
author: Emma H.

description:
This place used to be very tasty, and I'd go every few months.  Very disappointed by the last visit.  I'm giving it 2 stars just because it used to be tasty - I don't plan to come back at this point.

They swapped the chashu pork for some chicken.  Okay.  But it wasn't even good chicken, just some stringy bits of rib meat with a bit of fat and cartilage, no real flavor, and a long, sharp, needle of rib bone hidden in amongst the noodles for me to discover with my mouth.  The broth changed, too, and not for the better.
author: Ken S.

description: The ramen is overrated.  Broth is very salty and the noodles are not good.  also, they charged extra 35 cents for using credit card regardless how much your bill is.  Not going to go back again.
author: Ying C.

description: Absolutely delicious and worth putting your name down for the wait. I love how customizable it is for you to order the perfect ramen that you want!
author: Jennifer I.

description: Average tasting ramen. We managed to get a table at the newer shop. The tonkotsu ramen was good. Comparable in taste to other ramen places such as Katana-ya though. The depth of flavors in the soup was on spot. Added additional pork belly (kakuni). In terms of prices, it's somewhat pricey but not by much. Would I come back? Not likely. But who knows?
author: Henry P.

description: Decent ramen, but super expensive. Also, I ordered to go and they had a bunch of open seats so I asked if I could wait inside. They did not let me and I had to wait outside where it was freezing (and no one else was waiting), obnoxious. I would have moved if they needed the seat at the bar area - but the whole time I was there they did not come close to needing it.
author: Meredith L.

description: Delish!!  Loved the spicy miso with an egg, kimchi, and corn. Worth the wait if you have time. I went on a weekday and it was about a half an hour wait. Def would recommend it.
author: Maureen M.

description: First off, this place used to be my go-to Ramen joint for lunch and dinner. They've since drummed up a lot of business and changed locations. It's been so busy with all the new folks in the city I haven't been there for quite some time. Today, I went at 1:30pm. I waited about 15 minutes for 1 seat, which as it turned out was vacant the entire time I was waiting. After sitting down and ordering I waited another 25-30 minutes for my soup. When I got it I realized what took so long, they had to take the time to overcook the Chasu,  Kakuni & Egg. In fact, the only thing that wasn't overcooked were the raw mushrooms. While I used to love this place, it's lost it's flare with all the attention it's getting in the Fi-Di. Also they've raised their prices on items such as the Kakuni.
author: T T.

description:
"Meh, I've experienced better" pretty much sums it up. And in every case, much cheaper too. Their ramen is not only mediocre, it is way overpriced!!!! I don't think I've ever paid $16 for ramen before, anywhere, ever ($11/$12 gets you 1 piece of chashu and no egg, so I paid $3 more for extras), and I've eaten A LOT of ramen!!! So for that price, I expect it to be pretty damn good. But unfortunately it wasn't. 

3 stars for taste + 1 star for price = 2 stars overall
author: Darryl Y.

description: I am giving this place four stars. The ramen is good, everything else is just OK. The place is small, the prices are on a high side and the wait is long. I came here with two other coworkers and we all were  of the same opinion.
author: Tommy H.

description: Big fan of the ramen here. Lines suck so come early for lunch...we showed up at like 11:30 and still waited like 15min. I was a big fan of the spicy soy sauce ramen!  Had me sniffling like a baby.  Good spot for ramen dude
author: christopher h.

description: This place is hands down my favorite ramen in the city. And that means a lot coming from a serious ramen fan like me. I'd even go so far as to say it lives up to some of the great ramen I've eaten in Japan. Get the Spicy Miso Ramen (if you're into that sort of thing), get some extra pork belly (so good), and enjoy.
author: Dale K.

description: One of the better ramen places in the city. Great value for money. Can get busy and difficult to get a table for a group.
author: Suren E.

description: I'm not a huge fan of ramen (I actually prefer ramen from a cup or the large packs), but this place is pretty good and super close to where I work so it makes it convenient! I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty the ramen was. I ordered the the spicy ramen broth with pork. At lunch hours, this place can get really packed so plan accordingly.
author: Lillian C.

description: I'm giving a 3 stars cause I thought the place it's ok. I had better ramen. The bathroom is really dirty. There's flies flying around inside the bathroom.  I had spicy miso and it wasn't as good as I expected.  I asked to bring me a small bowl for my son and they never did. I asked couple of times. Not satisfy with my meal.
author: Lonni L.

description: Really liked the service here! The ramen was good, not the best but good and a little pricey but that's the city for ya.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I rarely write reviews. But this place deserves higher ratings! All these ramen snobs need to chill. I went in there for my first time today. Went in before 11 and there was no wait. Ordered the spicy miso soup with chicken broth & added spicy paste all to-go. First off, FINALLY I have found a place with decent chicken broth options! They have a large variety and this combo I got will clear your airways like no other! They give you about a quart for around $15. For the city, that's average and do-able. What I liked best was that this place sticks to simplicity while still being super tasty. Nothing too over the top like other ramen places. You get what you're coming for: RAMEN. If you're looking for a great ramen joint in FiDi then this is the place to try. But if you're expecting anything fancy and that's under $10, then you're in the wrong district AND city!
author: Ameera Z.

description: Excruciating wait. They really need to get act together. Very disorganized and unsure of how to service In a timely manner.
author: Brent S.

description: I had the spicy miso ramen and it was on point. Although it was so good, It made me feel the proportions were off being there was only 1 slice of pork. Overall being in the city, price was pretty good but more pork would've been very nice and more variety in vegetables.
author: Bruce L.

description:
the line here is ridiculous at lunch time. dont me surprised with an hour plus wait.. ive been here a handful of times. but ramen options in fidi are limited so i see why people wait for it. although not the best i've had the food is good. 

i always get a ramen. i've never gotten a donburi. i usually order spicy miso and add additional items b/c their basic toppings of bbq pork, onion, and mushrooms is just not enough.. you need to add pork belly, corn, and EGG!  you should also check out the specials on the wall. there were some delish appetizers that we ordered!
author: Jen S.

description: The search for amazing ramen is an endless attempt but the journey affords you to try ramens of all styles. Finally I was able to eat here and there is a uniqueness to the broth. Not quite as rich as I like my ramen broth to be but surprisingly very good and satisfying. The pork belly was delicious and the egg was soft and gooey on the inside. The whole is greater than the sum of the parts.
author: Theresa N.

description: Average quality, long wait, poor service and small portion size. You can do a lot better in SF than this place.
author: Alex A.

description: Came here on a Thursday a little after the lunch rush. Got seated within 15 minutes which was a definite plus. I got the soy sauce ramen with additional toppings: egg and corn (topping prices are pretty steep $1 for green onions?). The Ramen itself turned out to be a bit creamer then I expected out of a shoyu broth nevertheless it was delicious. I was very satisfied after having pretty average experiences that required long travel and waits. I think this place is definitely worth checking out especially on a lunch break (come around 1pm when the rush is gone).
author: Katya O.

description: I'm so bummed. As mentioned by another frequent customer, I've been going here for well over a year almost 3x a week as I work around the corner and do truly enjoy their ramen though the customer service is just bizarre to me. I work in customer service, and I think its so odd to not be personable or at least remember a face. Every time I come here I know exactly what I'm going to order before I sit down (mostly because I only have 30 minutes for lunch) and they consistently will come up to serve me water and as I immediately tell them I'm ready to order they apologize to go get a pad of paper ... why isn't it in your apron? ... and then take the order of 5 other people before me. I get it, but you see me 3x a week and I tell you the same thing .. every ... single ... time. To then top it off the prices are crazy since they moved. I will continue to eat here because I thoroughly enjoy the ramen but I'm very bummed with what Ramen Underground has become.
author: J A.

description: the creamy habanero miso ramen is off the hook. I just wonder why they would pick a small area for a place that is extremely busy. Ive only been here once but the ramen that was served to me makes me want to come eat here again. This place is 4 star due to be to small. Not very accommodating to large groups. other than that service was good enough and my meal was great. price range is fair.
author: Logan P.

description:
ive heard from a lot of city dwellers that ramen underground is their favorite spot in sf when i mention ramen dojo or himawari in san mateo. we decided to go the morning after thanksgiving dinner, hoping there wasn't a wait due to everyone being full from the day before. our strategy worked and we were seated immediately.

had the tonkatsu with kakuni, corn and egg with a side of kimchee and a large beef don to share. the kimchee was on point, perfectly sour for eating with ramen. the ramen was pretty good, the kakuni pork belly was an amazing topping but the noodle and broth, although delicious, was still seconds ramen dojo. the beef don, though good, a bit expensive for the ratio of meat to rice and nothing special.

had i had to wait the long lines at ramen dojo, i might have been a harsh on the hype for this ramen spot but all in all a great meal, just a bit pricey.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Fantastic ramen shop. I've eaten here several times and it's always been excellent. I recommend the spicy miso broth with bbq pork and a boiled egg. Yum!
author: Robere B.

description:
small ramen place near union square
bit pricey for what you get
am used to the great ramen down in LA's J town and off sawtelle
tried the spicy miso ramen - soup was a bit bland
didn't like the raw spinach in the broth
not sure the garlic butter added much to taste
author: Justin K.

description: We were walking to get pho and passed by Ramen Underground, so we decided to stop and try it since it was closer. When we walked in, before 12, there was a short wait. So glad we came early because it only got busier, and since the place is so small I would not have waited. It was a bit pricey and the service was a little slow for lunch time, but overall I liked it. They also forgot the diet coke we ordered and still charged us so we asked for it. It is really close to the office so we may venture in again to give it another shot!
author: Megan M.

description: Don't miss this place. If you like good things and you don't eat here you're super duper dumb.
author: Briana I.

description:
Since moving across the street, the price has gone up a couple of bucks for my normal order (habanero, kakuni, spinach, and egg), which now costs me $18 (includes a tip of $1+).  I notice I don't come here as much anymore and it's  definitely related to the price-just can't afford to come here that often.  In trying to keep my lunch price reasonable, I've stopped ordering spinach and kakuni.  So for $15 (includes tip), I just get an egg with habanero base which is poor values and not very satisfying.  That's why I'm knocking a star off the rating.  

Good for the restaurant that they can charge as much as they can keep a line outside.
author: C-C Y.

description: The place is really small and cramped. It was about a 25 minute wait for a party of 2 on a Friday night. Do not come with a large group or be prepared to wait forever. You may also need to share a table with another party as we did. The ramen itself was ok. I had the miso ramen and the miso wasn't quite flavorful enough. There was only 1 small slice of chashu in the bowl and the noodles were a bit softer than I wanted. The place also runs out of toppings and soup flavors.
author: Ali F.

description: Favorite ramen spot in SF. Their spicy miso ramen is crazy good and the extra chicken you can add to is is delicious. The location is pretty hidden matches the "ramen underground" feel. It's small inside too, so if you're eating there be ready to wait on line outside at peak hours. Bring cash as they don't accept cards. I take all my friends there and they all love in now too.
author: Kia Z.

description: Love this place, minus the lunch time lines. In the evenings during the week the waits are much shorter.
author: Lane L.

description: this restaurant only thinks profit. ingredient taste and staff quality tells everything.
author: Koji H.

description:
Not a good value for the price.

We came here for lunch. The broth and noodles were good. I got the tonkotso. For $12 you basically get a big bowl of broth, noodles, some mushrooms, spinach, and one thinly-sliced piece of chashu pork. 

It was not fulfilling and overpriced. We had to go across the street for a second meal.
author: Joseph K.

description: From the last time we visited, they remade themselves into an organic chicken based ramen shop. Good but sorely miss the pork based broth. Surprisingly few ramen options in the city, so this is about as good as it gets here. Service was less than stellar as it took much longer than was wanted. The shop itself was nicely decorated but the left the door propped open and it was cold inside
author: B A.

description:
Went to Ramen underground and ordered Ramen Miso with Onion to go.
Was asked to wait outside. Waited past 30mins and I checked with the person taking the order. Was told my order was lost.  They didn't even apologize. There was no one else waiting outside. They were busy counting there receipts and cash. The time was 3:30pm.
author: Mod Z.

description: Not bad...Really hits the spot. Would consider going here more often if I didn't already have my "Go-To" ramen spot in LA. Anyways, I got the pork ramen with pork everything and it was delicious. There was a huge line for it, and I had to wait about 20 minutes...But it was worth coming
author: Fermin B.

description: I'm writing this review on my phone because I am INCREDIBLY disappointed. First off, I understand the long wait but when people are next in line and there are empty tables, why can't they be seated? What's the policy on that? How could customers sitting while they wait for their food be less efficient than customers standing outside in the cold waiting for their food. I don't understand their seating policy. Second, service is extremely disorganized and inefficient. The guys were scrummaging around all flustered with no sense of good customer service nor attentiveness. It basically took them 10 minutes after we got our ramen for them to give us water. Third, the guy put in my order wrong. I wanted MISO not SALT and my salt ramen didn't even come with pork?? WTF. that's basically 3 strikes and there was no attempt to comp or make up our meal...what a shame. Oh and this is the best part, my friend ordered a beer, had already downed it, and when the waiter came over to give us our check, he goes,"...wait you're not 16 right??" LOL he basically could've gotten in big trouble for not checking someone's ID. this establishment is terrible, ramen is overrated, service is horrendous. You're lucky you're one of the only ramen places in FIDI.
author: Joyce M.

description: Ramen was okay. I would have liked if there was an egg with the ramen without any additional charges though. Was quite flavourful though.
author: Crystal W.

description: I used to swear by this place and frequent this location when I was working a few blocks away and when it was across the street. The ramen was previously worthy of enduring claustrophobia and being cramped up against strangers. I'm not sure what happened, but now it's nothing like it used to be!! It's like everyone (servers, cooks, etc) just stopped caring?! My friend and I came to Ramen Underground on Thursday and once we were seated, the server was rushing us to order when we had just received the menu. Then when I locked eyes with him later, indicating I was ready, he nodded over, acknowledging me but then went on to talk to his other server coworker. Once our ramen finally arrived, the broth was bland, portions were small, prices are overpriced, and corn was undercooked. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen. I don't understand why their standard ramen comes with chicken now? If I want chicken ramen, I'll specify if I do. Don't increase the price, expect me to pay more for chashu, then give me miniscule portions of both and expect me to pay an exorbitant price. Severely disappointed and will probably not come back for a while.
author: Clarissa M.

description: Noodles were not homemade service was mediocre at best and they charged an 18% Svc fee because I walked in with friends.
author: Andrew H.

description: My ramen was lukewarm, especially the pork within it. The noodles were on the al dente side. There were few vegetables. The flavors were uneven. I ate less than half before giving up. Rather than ask if I enjoyed it, the employee asked if I would leave a tip (in the tip jar that wasn't visible when I paid earlier).
author: Grace R.

description: I've been trying Ramen places in the city and this place is my favorite. Delicious delicious food. The Vegetable roll, I could eat every time I come. The only downside is its Cash Only but the world is full of ATM's and the food is worth it!! :-)
author: Jason B.

description: its a cool place to stop by for a casual dinner
author: Vegg C.

description: I would like to start off this review by saying this: this place sucks. Today my family and I wanted to have a nice lunch together, we drove 8 hours from home to visit my brother. I however, did not want ramen, so I purchased a sushi burrito about half a block down. When we entered this sad excuse for a restaurant, we were seated and they gave us room temperature water. As I opened my to-go box with hopeful eyes (keep in mind I was feeling quite frail since I hadn't eaten today, had been walking around, and it was about 2PM.) a waitress came over and ever so rudely said "no outside food in the restaurant okay?". I accepted this fate and stepped outside to eat my lunch, as I sat down on the dirty concrete I turned around in dismay to see two waitresses looking at me and laughing. Their actions were demeaning and uncalled for. My family proceeded to get up, gather their belonging, and leave without another word. This joke of an establishment should be looked down upon as a reprehensible blemish on the culinary arts. Please take your money and put it towards a business who treats their customers with respect. The idea that a "business" would rather lose the payment of three customers than allow me to enjoy a nice family lunch is baffling. If you're looking for a good ramen bowl in the area I'm 100% sure there are better choices (like the one we went to in the mall off of Market street who allowed me to eat my sushi burrito with no questions asked!). I think the owners and managers of this store should go over how waiters and waitresses should carry themselves and consider retraining. My return as a customer is 100% not plausible after the disrespect received today, I would never want food served to me at the hands of such a putrid staff. Aside from treatment, their prices aren't reasonable and their location is small and cramped, similar to the minds of the people running this pile of putrescence.
author: Noah D.

description: This place is not good, but for some reason always has a line out the door during lunch time.  Limited seating, and not so ideal for larger groups.  Let's talk about the ramen.  It flat out sucks. Broth was thin and lacked flavor.  Noodles were hard and were prepared more like al dente pasta in a shitty broth.  They give you tiny pieces of pork belly and 1 incredibly small piece of char siu that was just pitiful to look at.   I got a bowl of spicy miso with pork belly, corn, and a egg and my grand total was freaking $16 and some change.... Hmmmm... A bit overpriced in my opinion, but keep in mind the location is in the Financial District, so this is why they can get away with the ridiculous pricing.  They forgot my egg too, which kind of annoyed me even more cause I was there on a rainy day and hoped the ramen would be somewhat of a decent experience.  Don't waste your time and money.  I'm not even a ramen snob or anything, but I assume the majority of the people go to ramen places mainly for the broth.  If you love good broth this is definitely not the place for you.
author: Eric C.

description: Oh man...how unfortunate. Tried the Tonkatsu Ramen last night just before closing. ..loved it and decided to go back with the family tonight...having waited for 45 minutes i had been waiting for a table a good 15minutes longer than the new crowd that had formed...yet this one server seated another party before me and then erased my name from the waiting list...he proceeded to call another name before mine...his response to my protest was "does it really matter who goes in first?" I told him how long I've been waiting and he says "fine, go in"...as I went in with my family..he didn't realize my wife was still standing next to him outside the door as he told the party after me "don't worry, I'll treat you better than him"...what nerve. Just so there's no mistaking who the server was...he was the only Non-Asian serving tables this evening the 22nd of November...sorry, we thought we could get passed the mess when the bowls came but couldn't...as far as we were concerned the food might have been good but we were too upset to tell...thank you who ever you are for ruining a much anticipated meal.
author: Orlando J.

description: Service takes forever to seat people even though there was plenty of open tables. Ordered the ramen and even though I made a mistake they were complete jerks about how I made my order. I don't care how good their food is, if they make me wait 10 minutes even though half the restaurant was empty and that we still need to wait to be seated
author: Wilson W.

description: The food (ordered a spicy miso ramen) was good. Ive had a lot of japanese ramen and this was quite decent, not the best of the best. It is a little pricey, I recommend for those who dont eat much or trying to cut out some carbs to share with someone, and its so customized, you can add in extra meat, veggies, egg, etc. The place is small so it wouldnt be convenient for a large group. Service wasn't very good, waiters were very busy so you need to call them every time you need something.
author: Amber R.

description: Good but not great ramen. The old place across the street was great. The chicken teriyaki is surprisingly tasty if you fancy switching it up a bit. Accepting cash only in this era is just annoying though and the small space is not kid friendly.
author: 1 D.

description: Yum! they make good ramen. Good noodles, rich and creamy broth. Perfect for a cold day! I recommend going on the weekend, because it gets super crowded during the week (for good reason).
author: Tara S.

description: Been there twice now, first time I got it to go, so I wasn't going to just judge them based on it. This time after sitting in, I'm just not really impressed. I guess I've been pretty spoiled with really good ramen in the south bay, so my standards may be high, but the hype surrounding this place just simply doesn't match what I was eating. I got the shio (salt) ramen and it was ok. The broth just wasn't that flavorful, but possibly that's because I like pork broths more than chicken broths. The meat was pretty good. I got extra pork belly just to try it, and it was ok. I guess 3 stars because it wasn't bad, it just wasn't worth the hype
author: Edison T.

description: Just moved to a new location and raised prices by 25% which means a bowl of ramen with some meat and veggies is now approaching $20 which is absurd.
author: Christian B.

description: although i was initially feeling iffy because the food came out a bit too quick, the portions were fairly large, and the broth was pretty good. i feel like the broth at iza ramen tasted better but the servings in this bowl seemed larger. overall I would come back. service was also good.
author: Vijith N.

description: thoroughly enjoyed the ramen from this location.....there were 2 empty bowls when we were done, one for me and one for my wife...good to the last drop.
author: Dennis H.

description: The best ramen I've EVER had. The spicy miso is my favorite. I crave it weekly now! No where else in SF compares. It's well worth the wait. It never disappoints!
author: Molly A.

description: Great ramen, always packed at lunch so I decided to try dinner tonight..terrible dinner service. The guys are running around like chickens without heads and have ignored me.
author: Jannelly D.
